text:
hi everyone today I am making a very special 
video as a big thank-you to all of you my viewers

because hot Thai Kitchen has reached a hundred 
thousand subscribers a hundred thousand that is

crazy and I could not have done it without all 
of you so I wanted to make a little behind the

scene video to invite you in to take a look at 
what goes on around here how each video gets

made okay so I'm gonna take you on a tour from the 
very beginning to the very end let's get started

so this is where every hot thai kitchen episode 
starts it starts in my food laboratory ie my

kitchen so yes this is my kitchen and the reason 
why I don't film here is because as you can see it

is very small and there's really no good angle for 
the camera to go but it works really well as my

work space is where I test all my recipes before I 
go to shoot and you come over here I will show you

a little bit of the process so this is sort of 
my office space in this kitchen this is all the

recipes that I am going to test for the show and 
if the sheet looks very clean it probably means

I haven't tested it because if I have it'll look 
more like this so this was sort of the previous

iteration and I've made notes I make notes as 
I go too you know changes improvements whatever

comes to mind and then this sheet right here all 
handwritten this is our my drawing board these

are all my ideas it may or may not make it to a 
video it's just sort of I I have an idea let's

write it down but I just put it up here to make 
sure I don't forget about it and yeah basically

it goes from here to here and to you I'll show 
you my fridge but there's a lot of stuff in here

okay every ingredient ever should be in hot Thai 
kitchen is probably in here there's shrimp paste

tamarind this is oyster sauce which by the way 
keeping oyster sauce in a squeeze bottle makes

it so much easier to use salted duck egg is 
my chili oil yeah you know lots of stuff and

now you must be wondering if I don't film here 
then where is the hot Thai kitchen kitchen but

let's go look for those of you who have been 
with me from the very beginning you know that

hot I kitchen started out in my little apartment 
in San Francisco well years later here we are in

Vancouver Canada and we shoot in this cute little 
neighborhood called Yale town and I particularly

love this place because there's the grocery store 
literally next door to where we shoot and so when

I forget things it's very useful so here we are in 
the hot Thai kitchen set that you're familiar with

and this is actually my friend Adams apartment and 
Adam is also the cameraman and he's a bit camera

shy so he's just gonna say hi to you from behind 
the camera alright there he is and Adams kitchen

is perfect in many many ways one of which being 
the fact that Adam doesn't cook so there's a lot

of space for me to work with I'm not interfering 
with his cooking in any way because there is none

so much and he enjoys the food yes he gets to eat 
everything that is made on how tight kitchen so

he enjoys the food so so it's a great setup for 
us just to show you a little bit of how this is

set up there's usually two cameras and one which 
is a close-up camera which is right about here

and the other one usually sits right in front of 
this counter that captures me on the wide-angle

I've got both going and if you're interested my 
the camera that I use really nothing fancy it's

a Canon mirrorless and both of them they were on 
sale when I got if you're familiar with hot Thai

kitchen from the very beginning you know that 
there have been quite a few people behind the

camera basically depending on where I am in 
Thailand in San Francisco here and it's all

just been a production of friends and family 
none of us are professional so we've all had

to learn on our own it's been it's been really a 
fun learning process Adam and I both have learned

a lot and then when the shooting is done I am 
back here at my other office so this is where

the editing happens I do all the editing and I use 
Final Cut Pro for most of you who are interested I

started out very simply I think I used Windows 
Movie Maker and then iMovie and then finally

Final Cut Pro and I basically taught myself 
how to do all the editing so it's been it's

been a fun journey so once it's done I upload it 
to YouTube and then I go and make a post on my

website and write up the recipe and then unleash 
it to the world and that is it I hope you enjoyed

that little insight look into the making of hot 
pie kitchen and again if you want to connect

with me I'm on Facebook Twitter and Instagram 
and a big thank you to everyone top Khun kha
